alert.note: Alert for Central Sacramento Valley; Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued September 01 at 2:49AM PDT until September 01 at 7:00PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE DOE AND ELKHORN FIRES IN THE AUGUST COMPLEX BURN SCAR AND MCFARLAND IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM PDT THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall are possible over the Doe and Elkhorn Fires in the August Complex Burn Scar and McFarland burn scars. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following areas, Central Sacramento Valley and Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County. * WHEN...From 11 AM PDT this morning through 7 PM PDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Thunderstorms with heavy rainfall over the Doe and Elkhorn Fires in the August Complex and McFarland burn scars are expected up to and during the period of the watch. Residents near the Doe and Elkhorn Fires in the August Complex and McFarland burn scars should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the Doe and Elkhorn Fires in the August Complex and McFarland burn scars, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Central Sacramento Valley; Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County
